text: I’m using POWER theme and trying to troubleshoot some missing variables.  But I can’t view the theme’s fields.json because it’s too large.  The HubSpot recommendation is to use the cli to view it however it’s forbidden to fetch a marketplace theme.  Additionally I can’t right click the json file an copy to the child theme.  The only options on right click for the fields,json is version history file information.  Anyone know how I can view the fields.json?
Hi <@UBNBAAQSH> I am part of the maka team and happy to help with your questions

in the CSS folder, there is a _variables.css, we don't recommend overwriting the file in the child theme, but you should be able to find the variable you're looking for.

If you can share more details, I can also help
The fields.json shouldn't be copied to a child theme or it can create breaking changes with future updates

Thanks for the reply, Jennifer, mainly I was trying to backtrack and figure out why our boxed elements wasn’t pulling in the hover states.  I was able to find the section in the variables.css that would style that field.  It looked like .pwr-image-box:hover .pwr-image-box__overlay {
  background-color: var(--mod-imgb-clr-hover-box-background); } wasn’t pulling in any values for the variable.  (oddly it seems like it’s working now but the designer is also working on this so maybe he’s done something)
Is this related to the update?
do you have a link you can share so I can take a closer look?
we’re uncertain if it was the update or not.  our COO did the update (for some reason) and we noticed after that the boxes weren’t hovering right
ah ok - that's good news actually.
i don’t think i have a link to share, its still in preview
the overrides work
So HubSpot started sending the update email to all Super Admins, so we've seen a lot of updates happening without reading the documentation.
are you using a child theme?
yeah we have a child theme

all you need to do is update the base.html with the updated code to work with v26/v28 and you should be all set.

<https://www.maka-agency.com/child-theme-base-html-update>
I did do that after the fact, I don’t think there was anything new, i’ll look again

If you have custom modules created with the old code base, they will still rely on jQuery and the old code structure - we have a theme setting that accounts for this, but at some point you will want to <https://www.maka-agency.com/next-steps-for-custom-modules-with-jquery|convert them> so you can continue to recieve updates.
there is one line that changed between v26 and v28 - line 22
luckily this one is new enough we haven’t done any custom modules yet
oh and now i’m seeing that this page is using the parent theme template and not the child theme template

ah, ok - interesting. Can you check if the performance settings are updated:

theme settings > performance > super admin
you can disable all 3 settings for the marketplace theme and the child since it has no customization.
yeah i did those on both the child and parent
ok, it's a little tricky without a link, can you send a screenrecording of the issue with the hover state?
okay i made sure all the things are unchecked and that base.html was updated.  we’ve taken off the override on the first box in this section, and now it appears the variables are not populating
here’s one that has an override and works right

oddly what happens on that first one, you hover the box, the text chagnes as expected but the background color does not but when you mouse out, you can see the bg color for a split second and then it goes away
<@UHDEVB0S1> can you look at the issue with the variable here for pwr-image-box:hover?
the selector for that is .pwr-image-box:hover .pwr-image-box__overlay since it’s being covered up by the inspector tool tip there
It's 10 pm for him in Germany, so I'm not sure if he can look today, but since you have the overwrite working hopefully it's not too much trouble.
here’s a loom: <https://www.loom.com/share/7da286b42f704795b9b43f81b1d75d05?sid=e0037bc6-b542-4be0-8177-a388dcc02615>
no worries, thanks for the help!

ah, interesting - it's Firefox - can you check if it's the same in Chrome?

We had some recent issues with different browsers, mostly Safari and FF not respecting the Z-position
same issues on chrome unfortunately
ok, no problem, good to know though
and same issue on the designers computer (different ISP etc) both mac though
I sent him a message directly and will keep an eye out for a response if he doesn't write back here first. With it being Friday night, it'll likely be Monday before we can isolate the issue
no problem do you want me to open a ticket somewhere?
if it's not too much trouble, you can <https://www.maka-agency.com/submit-support-ticket|submit the details here>, but it's no trouble to follow up in slack if that's easier for you
i’ll throw it in a ticket, god knows the slack window will get hidden under a million other things :wink:
sounds good, will follow up with you there :slightly_smiling_face:
